content: In the tightly regulated city of Stenograd, life runs on the silent algorithms of the Behavioral Compliance Index, a system that tracks every move and quietly shapes every fate. When the system’s architect, Marek Halden, is found dead under mysterious circumstances, the city’s automated order unravels: labor assignments are thrown into chaos, high-ranking citizens are sent to menial work while the flagged and forgotten suddenly occupy sensitive roles, and confusion erupts across every sector. As Oksana Lintz, a high-level administrator, isolates failing protocols to contain the damage, task mismatches multiply and unrest sweeps the city, shaking public faith in the very system meant to guarantee stability. Amid the disorder, hundreds of vanished citizens—long presumed erased by the BCI—reappear, slipping through system blind spots to build covert networks that supply locked-down neighborhoods and subvert old hierarchies. The Council, fractured by blame and desperation, fails to restore order, while the distinction between the ‘compliant’ and the ‘invisible’ dissolves. As these formerly unseen residents quietly reshape Stenograd from within, the city’s trust in its own mechanisms collapses, leaving demands for new leadership and the promise of unexpected change in the air.
